results.title: Cigarettes
results.material_description:
Digital video, bespoke artist box
edition 4 of 6 (+2 artist's proofs)
single channel 4:3 animation, colour, silent, continuous loop
media player, two SD cards, archival USB drive
results.brief_description:
“Cigarettes” is a single-channel projected animation, created as part of the “Christian Marclay: Six Animations” exhibition, which debuted at 49 Geary Street, San Francisco, April 28 – June 25 2016. In this animation, static photographs of cigarette butts have been edited together and played back in quick succession to give the illusion of motion.

Unlike traditional animation in which the setting is consistent and spatial continuity is maintained, in this work the background changes frantically. The flickering images recall flip-books, early cinema, and animation devices of the late nineteenth century, such as the zoetrope used by Eadweard Muybridge. Marclay’s animations set the discarded trails of rubbish in motion, giving the humble objects new life and transforming his chance encounters with trash into visual poetry.

Sourced from Fraenkel Gallery: https://fraenkelgallery.com/exhibitions/christian-marclay-six-new-animations

results.title: Straford video memories
results.creator_credit: Frank Straford, John Straford and Inala Video
results.brief_description:
Video memories of the Victorian west coast and bushfires in the north-east produced by the Straford family.
“Gone to blazes” contains footage broadcast by national and commercial TV channels during the course of the devastating bushfires that ravaged the Victorian north-east early in 2003.

results.title: Beneath our feet. Parts 1-3
results.creator_credit: Bob Scarfe and TV Ed Productions
results.brief_description: The Scenery of Victoria looks at the landforms throughout the state and relates the actual location to its geological significance. “Geological history of Victoria” Very similar to Part 1, but made for year 10 science with more emphasis on the period of history each geological type fits into. “Granite” looks at the formation and coding processes that produce granite with emphasis on the seven types of rocks that are currently associated with granite.

results.title: Don't think I don't think. Fair enough
results.creator_credit: Dale Baker, Hodja Ed Res Co-op, La Trobe University, Open Channel Productions and Preston Institute of Technology
results.brief_description: 1. “Don’t think I don’t think”. A workshop of the 1981 South Pacific Regional Conference on Mental Retardation. 2. “Fair enough”. The experiences of students finding difficulty in mantaining dignity and rights in the face of “hidden curricula” of school.
